item.title: New Netflix Series is Getting an Official Game in Roblox
item.description:
The global classic Winx Club franchise is officially entering into the world of Roblox with Winx Club: Magix , a brand-new video game adventure based on the upcoming animated series Winx Club: The Magic is Back , coming to Netflix on October 2, 2025. Set to launch on September 15 across all Roblox gaming platforms, Winx Club: Magix will bring the magic of the Winx Club world to life with an immersive experience where players can become their very own fairy persona.

First premiering in Italy in 2004 before making its way to audiences in the United States in 2005, Winx Club is a modern fantasy animated series that follows six magical fairies as they learn lessons of growth, love, and friendship in their world of Magix. The franchise is beloved for its colorful world, relatable characters, and unique magic, making it one of the most popular animated series on Nickelodeon. With an upcoming reboot slated to release on Netflix in October, Winx Club is set to embark on an exciting new video game crossover with Roblox .

Winx Club: Magix Trailer and Gameplay Details

Rainbow SpA, the studio behind the Winx Club franchise, revealed the first teaser trailer for Winx Club: Magix , a new official game within Roblox . Winx Club: Magix will let players create their own fairy with customizable avatars, shimmering wings, and enchanted accessories, before setting off through the grand halls of Alfea College and training their powers to master elemental magic. Fans will get to embark on high-stakes quests through the streets of Magix and team up with friends to tackle dungeons teeming with magical creatures, uncover hidden realms brimming with lore, and collect rare artifacts to evolve their fairies' powers. The game will evolve as players progress, with Winx Club: Magix set to offer seasonal events and limited-time challenges to keep the world alive with ever-changing opportunities. Winx Club: Magix looks to join a growing lineup of hit games in Roblox when it launches on September 15.

Winx Club: Magix will be the latest video game in the beloved fairy series, following earlier releases like Winx Club: Quest for the Codex on Game Boy Advance, Winx Club: Join the Club on PSP, and Dance Dance Revolution: Winx Club for the Nintendo Wii, among others. Players who enjoy video games with fantasy settings or who grew up with the Winx Club animated show and its reboots can check out Winx Club: Magix in Roblox and can watch the series that inspired it, Winx Club: The Magic is Back , on Netflix beginning October 2.

A number of classic TV shows with new video games have caught the attention of nostalgia-seeking fans, with the likes of Totally Spies and now Winx Club drawing audiences into fresh gaming experiences with old-school vibes. With players continuing to voice an appreciation for classic franchises getting unexpected revivals, Winx Club fans are keeping their fingers crossed that Winx Club: Magix will bring a perfect balance of familiar fairy magic with a brand-new adventure.

item.title: Best Silksong Mods To Install
item.description:
Hollow Knight: Silksong is shaping up to be worth all the hype it had generated in the years that Team Cherry had left fans in the dark. This small team loved the process of developing this sequel and threw so many ideas into the cauldron that a mere DLC transformed into a full-blown standalone game.

Hornet's adventures in Pharloom are a blast to engage with as players get used to the game's new mechanics, brush up on their knowledge of the first game, and figure out the many new ways that Team Cherry has made fans rage. PC players can enjoy the added benefit of mods to make things easier for themselves.

ShowDamage HealthBar

Gives Players A Clear Idea Of The Health Enemies Have

  • Mod Link

Enemies in Pharloom take a few hits to go down, with most players becoming aware of the number of times they have to use Hornet's needle to take out these foes. However, a bit of clarity in this regard is always welcome, which is where this mod comes into the picture.

It lets players see their damage numbers along with enemy health bars. This makes every upgrade to Hornet's needle feel all the more meaningful as players palpably see how much stronger their attacks are.

No Double Damage

The Double Damage In This Game Is Grating To Deal With

  • Mod Link

Hornet heals faster, but Team Cherry decided to balance this in the most sadistic manner possible. A lot of enemies in the game now take out two notches of health with each attack, which can feel very overbearing for players who haven't adjusted to the difficulty yet.

This can be fixed with a simple mod that goes a long way in making the game less difficult for players. The fact that enemies don't shave off a ton of the health bar with a single hit does wonders for players who are struggling with the game's challenge.

Simple Rosary Cheat

An Easy Way To Get A Ton Of Money In No Time

  • Mod Link

It almost feels like Rosaries are rarer than ever before in Silksong , compared to Geo from the first game. Hornet may be drowning in Shell Shards, but players will be desperate to get their hands on as many Rosaries as possible.

If the idea of losing Rosaries and being unable to afford valuable items is getting to players, they can always use a mod that magically causes their Rosary haul to be enhanced by a 1000. Sure, it may be a cheat, but there's nothing wrong with getting an unfair advantage in single-player games, especially if players are finding it hard to get through the game otherwise.

Teleport

Replicates The Dreamgate Ability From The First Game

  • Mod Link

Getting the Dreamgate upgrade in Hollow Knight was a boon for players who didn't want to make the same Boss Run over and over again to reach a foe. Players will be robbed of this ability in Silksong , but they may not have to deal with these annoying runs with this mod.

As the name suggests, this mod lets players teleport wherever they want. It cuts out a lot of the rigmarole and lets players get into the meat of the game instead of just trimming the fat over and over again after dying.

Always Have Compass

Saves Players From Using A Valuable Crest Slot

  • Mod Link

The Wayward Compass was one of the most valuable Charms in Hollow Knight that let players track their location on a map. This appears in Silksong as well, although players have to use a valuable Crest Slot to equip this tool.

This requirement can be circumvented with a mod that ensures players will always know their location on the map at all times. The Crest Slot that's saved can be used for other valuable tools to bolster Hornet's aptitude in combat and exploration.

Always Have Magnet

Hornet Doesn't Have To Run Around To Get Rosaries And Shell Shards

  • Mod Link

Rosaries can be easy to miss, and backtracking to get any Rosary that has fallen somewhere else can be a pain. This is why the Magnetite Brooch is so useful for players who just want to kill enemies and have money flying towards their pockets.

Again, this consumes a valuable Crest Slot, a requirement that can be circumvented with this mod. Players don't have to worry about being inefficient with their tools anymore, since the Magnetite Brooch's effects will always remain active regardless of whether it's equipped or not.

AutoMap

Players Don't Ned To Sit On A Bench To Update The Map

  • Mod Link

Fans of Hollow Knight are aware that the map of a region isn't updated until after players either rest or respawn on a Bench. It's a smart mechanic, albeit one that some people may find tiring.

With this mod, Hornet's adventures are instantly recorded on the map without any delay. This ensures that exploration feels less oppressive as players have a clear idea of where they are and the pathways that they might've missed out on.

Double Rosaries

The Functionality Of This Mod Is Pretty Obvious

  • Mod Link

The grind for Rosaries can get really annoying in Silksong , after a point. This is why the Double Rosaries mod is such a no-brainer for players who don't want to kill every enemy in sight just to get richer.

It may take away from the game's balance somewhat, but this is something that most people are willing to accept. If the tradeoff is that they aren't broke throughout the game, then it's more than worth it.

item.title: For Better or Worse, Cronos: The Dawn Can't Escape One Survival Horror Trope
item.description:
Cronos: The New Dawn continues down a path set forth by giants of the survival horror genre, while putting its own spin on some of the established conventions. Following its success and acclaim with Silent Hill 2 Remake last year, which banished many of the doubts that sometimes surrounded developer Bloober Team previously, the studio then swiftly turned its attention to its next project. Cronos: The New Dawn is a new IP for Bloober, and it more or less marks it moving from indie or AA status firmly to an AAA survival horror studio.

By Bloober's own admission, Cronos: The New Dawn intentionally follows some well-worn but effective patterns, evidenced by the fact that it has specifically mentioned Dead Space and Resident Evil 4 as major inspirations. Both are seminal survival horror games, and Cronos clearly draws much from them. Along with those, though, it also includes a design element that has been seen in tons of other survival horror titles, and one that has been ingrained in the genre to such a degree that it verges on being clich at this point.

Cronos: The New Dawn Still Has Players Using Boltcutters, For Better or Worse

Boltcutters Have Long Been a Staple of Survival Horror

Going back to the earliest days when the visual and design language of survival horror games was being established, one of the most ubiquitous items found in them was a trusty pair of boltcutters. It's an incredibly mundane item at the end of the day, but admittedly a realistic and useful one, and countless games in the genre have had them over the years. For example, nearly every Resident Evil has had the tool, and they can also be found in most Silent Hill entries. This extends to many others, including recent games like Post Trauma , and Cronos: The New Dawn is no exception.

In many cases, finding a pair of boltcutters in a given survival horror title constitutes its own puzzle or subtask. They are usually necessary for players to acquire in order to access subsequent story locations. Alongside this, they often unlock optional or secret areas. It may in fact be more surprising at this point for players not to have to make use of them somewhere along the line. But that comes with the risk of boltcutters being completely overdone, especially in Cronos: The New Dawn 's case.

Cronos: The New Dawn's Reliance on Boltcutters Can Be a Bit Much, Even by Modern Standards

In keeping with tradition, during the opening hours of their mission to travel back in time in search of important people classified as "Essences" before a devastating plague wiped out humanity and horribly warped the survivors, Cronos: The New Dawn 's armor-clad protagonist, the Traveler, will find a pair of boltcutters. These are then employed as expected throughout to progress or loot optional rooms. However, their use is arguably made more egregious than normal in Cronos: The New Dawn , due to the placement of safe rooms and the initially quite limited inventory space.

It's overall more efficient to commit to sacrificing a slot for the boltcutters for the entire playthrough, since there are just enough locked doors scattered throughout each level that it ends up being more expedient and convenient to have the boltcutters on hand to access these areas upon finding them, rather than having to backtrack quite a distance to the hub to retrieve them in many instances. The situation is also somewhat ironic in that neither of Cronos: The New Dawn 's biggest influences actually had boltcutters, making them rare exceptions, and thus Cronos stands out even more in light of this.

While the inclusion of boltcutters in survival horror games may boil down to subjectivity in terms of how bothersome or blatantly formulaic they can feel, Cronos: The New Dawn 's use of them begs the question of whether the genre at large will eventually find a way to move beyond them, or if they have become such an intrinsic part of the experience that most titles will continue to feel compelled to include them.

item.title: Genshin Impact Players Can Earn Free 5-Star Constellations, But There's a Catch
item.description:
Starting in Version 6.0, Genshin Impact players will be able to obtain Constellations for certain 5-Star characters, and HoYoverse has finally revealed the full details of this system. While Genshin Impact designs its content to be accessible to casual players, the same cannot be said for its endgame. The Spiral Abyss, Imaginarium Theater, and Stygian Onslaught ask for a considerable amount of skill or a considerable amount of investment.

Horizontal investment can best be observed with certain 5-Star perfect pairs: Escoffier and Skirk, Mavuika and Citlali, Flins and Ineffa. On the other hand, vertical investment in Genshin Impact takes the form of Constellations, and in the ever-growing difficulty of its endgame, they can be extremely valuable for certain 5-Stars to keep up with the meta. Genshin Impact characters like Yae Miko or Shenhe greatly benefit from having even one Constellation unlocked, and this is precisely where the new feature will shine.

Genshin Impact: To Temper Thyself and Journey Far

Eligible Characters

  • Baizhu Dendro Catalyst
  • Dehya Pyro Claymore
  • Wanderer Anemo Catalyst
  • Nilou Hydro Sword
  • Cyno Electro Polearm
  • Tighnari Dendro Bow
  • Ayato Hydro Sword
  • Yae Miko Electro Catalyst
  • Shenhe Cryo Polearm
  • Itto Geo Claymore
  • Kokomi Hydro Catalyst
  • Yoimiya Pyro Bow
  • Ayaka Cryo Sword
  • Eula Cryo Claymore
  • Hu Tao Pyro Polearm
  • Xiao Anemo Polearm
  • Ganyu Cryo Bow
  • Albedo Geo Sword
  • Tartaglia Hydro Bow
  • Klee Pyro Catalyst
  • Keqing Electro Sword
  • Mona Hydro Catalyst
  • Qiqi Cryo Sword
  • Diluc Pyro Claymore
  • Jean Anemo Sword

Rules

  • Players can only claim one Constellation per 5-Star character.
  • Players cannot claim a Constellation for a 5-Star character they have not yet obtained.
  • The reward does not carry over into the next cycle. Players must select their Constellation before the cycle ends.

Version 6.0 will launch a new Permanent Event that will allow Genshin Impact players to earn up to four Constellations per year. This will apply to both Standard and Limited characters, but there are a few things to keep in mind. Except for Alhaitham, Yelan, and Kazuha, only non-Archon characters released before Version 4.0 are supported by the new feature. HoYoverse has claimed that subsequent event cycles will introduce more 5-Stars to the pool, which will likely coincide with Chronicled Banners in Genshin Impact .

This first cycle for 'To Temper Thyself and Journey Far' will commence with the launch of Version 6.0 and will last until December 1, 2025. These cycles are intended to last roughly twelve weeks, with a reset on Monday. To obtain a Constellation, Genshin Impact players need to complete their weekly training goal for eight weeks out of the total twelve. To complete a weekly training goal, players must spend 120 Original Resin in Genshin Impact on top of completing their Daily Commissions for at least five days in a week.

Players will be able to use the system to obtain a Masterless Stella Fortuna from Standard Banner characters, granting them another long-term source of ascending their favorite characters to the new level cap in Genshin Impact . While modern 5-Stars are better suited to tackling new content, 'To Temper Thyself and Journey Far' will allow players to upgrade some classic 5-Stars such as Hu Tao, Ayaka, and Nilou, with the latter becoming popular again due to Lauma. Version 6.0 is set to launch on September 10.

item.title: Upcoming Open-World Games With No Combat
item.description:
The gaming industry continues to evolve, with developers exploring new ways to engage players beyond traditional combat systems. A growing number of open-world games now emphasize creativity, exploration, and player-driven storytelling, without the need for intense fights or stressful enemy encounters.

These projects appeal to audiences looking for immersive worlds that reward curiosity rather than conflict. By shifting the focus to discovery and cooperation, these upcoming open-world games offer alternative experiences that highlight the versatility of the genre, where enjoyment can come from places other than combat.

Misty Valley: A Cozy Fishing Tale

Peace On The Open Waves

  • Release Date : October 2025
  • Developer : No Plan Games
  • Platforms : PC

Misty Valley takes leisure as its primary focus, allowing players to peacefully fish and explore the world with little to no pressure at all. The game blends relaxation with discovery, and rather than tension or combat, the experience relies on simplistic management within a tranquil setting.

The valley itself is designed as a living environment, filled with secrets, seasonal changes, and opportunities for gentle progression. Players can improve their skills, forge connections, and explore hidden waterways at their own pace, demonstrating how comfort and calm can become the guiding principles of an expansive game world.

Paralives

Carving Out Your Very Own Life Story

Paralives
Life Simulation
Systems
Released
December 8, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Paralives Studio
Powered by

Paralives stands as an ambitious life simulation within a modest open environment that lets players create and shape lives in the world around them. Its systems encourage experimentation and long-term planning, giving players a lot of freedom in terms of customization regarding how they want to approach every aspect, from housing to clothing.

The game world is dynamic and open to any interpretation, allowing unique homes, neighborhoods, and communities to flourish. By focusing on relationships and personal expression, Paralives reinforces the idea that compelling gameplay can emerge from something as simple as an everyday activity.

VISK

Eerie Environments With No End In Sight

  • Release Date : 2025
  • Developers : Orionis Productions
  • Platforms : PC

Visk offers a surreal and deeply haunting open world full of dreamlike landscapes that are rich with symbolism and abstract design. Exploration serves as both a gameplay and narrative device, as players navigate the creepy village in search of answers, but they never feel truly alone.

The absence of combat allows for greater emphasis on mood, art direction, and environmental storytelling. Each area invites players to wander freely, uncovering meaning through the world around them, and rather than forcing them to fight their way to the end, they must instead fight against the fear in their own minds.

Cairn

Realistic Climbing In A Beautiful Stylized World

Cairn
Simulation
Adventure
Survival
Systems
Released
November 5, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
The Game Bakers
Powered by

Cairn is about as close to a rock climbing simulator as there has ever been. Players are tasked with scaling mountains full of physical and mental challenges, forcing them to make decisions about where to place their limbs and how best to approach the next section of the ascent.

The only real fight is against the elements, as players quickly realize that the real danger is the environment itself. With a cozy yet challenging feel, Cairn looks to be the perfect blend of exploration and introspection, taking players on a journey that is both physically and mentally taxing.

Easy Delivery Co.

Monotony Becomes Mystery

  • Release Date : Q3 2025
  • Developers : Sam C
  • Platforms : PC, macOS

Easy Delivery Co. is a cute open-world game about delivering packages to the strange residents living in a secluded mountain town. The game feels like a combination of Animal Crossing and Euro Truck Simulator , blending cozy aesthetics with satisfying driving mechanics that never extend too far into the realm of stress.

There is a lot of character to the way the game is presented, with just enough jank and charm to keep players smiling through the cold, dark nights. The focus is placed on the characters in the world, as players slowly build up relationships and become more accustomed to the warm yet undeniably strange atmosphere that coats every aspect of the game.

Outbound

Driving Turned Into Base-Building Madness

Outbound
Open-World
Survival
Crafting
Exploration
Systems
Developer(s)
Square Glade Games

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Outbound captures the quiet spirit of road travel. Players inhabit a detailed world designed for exploration by vehicle and on foot, journeying through varied environments that are filled with beauty and wonder rather than fights to take on.

Freedom defines its design philosophy. Every trip offers opportunities to interact with communities, maintain vehicles, and discover the wider world. Aside from traveling, players can construct increasingly elaborate bases that can be taken on the go, allowing them to continue exploring whilst still having a place to call home.

Big Walk

Going On A Journey Together

Big Walk
Adventure
Exploration
Puzzle
Systems
Released
2026

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
House House
Powered by

Big Walk presents an open-world adventure defined by curiosity and collaboration. Developed by House House, known for its unconventional game design, this title invites players into a surreal wilderness filled with puzzles, secrets, and unexpected discoveries.

Instead of fighting, the fun comes from exploration, environmental interactions, and cooperation with friends. The expansive landscapes are deliberately structured to promote communication and teamwork, shifting the focus towards a shared, comforting experience that strays as far away from stressful combat as possible.
